steps.text: In a forgotten library, you discover a book wrapped in black cloth. It whispers your name.
You unwrap it. The title reads: 'The Cursed City Palace of Jaipur'. Pages are blank—then they turn on their own.
A voice whispers: 'You wanted to read about the empty palace... Let me take you there.' You float, sucked into darkness. You land in front of Mubarak Mahal. It's a moonlit night. The palace is empty.
You hear footsteps echoing. A flicker of movement—spirits of old pehredaars.
You find shelter. The whispering grows louder.
A pehredaar’s spirit finds you. Flying swords execute you instantly.
You hear a voice that says you made a mistake in Marwari and are hit by a flying mace. Darkness consumes you.
You cross the courtyard safely. Faint chanting draws you toward a glowing arch.
Inside, murals pulse with eerie life. A hooded spirit gestures silently.
An inscription reads: “Above the moon, beyond the fire — the mantra lies on Chandra’s spire.” “Speak it to awaken the sleeping gods.”
It leads you to a stairway below. You descend into the darkness.
A child's spirit blocks your path. It opens your skull with a giggle.
You find yourself in Rajendra Pol. Giant silver urns gleam in moonlight.
Inside the urn, you find a lighter. You ignite it. Walls shimmer with hidden writing.
You trip. Ghost dogs swarm and devour you.
The writing says: The mantra is etched atop Chandra Mahal. That alone can save you.
You reach Pritam Chowk. Four gates stare at you.
You fall into a deep stone chamber. You never hit the ground.
You enter a hall of paintings. The eyes begin to move.

choices.text: Cover your eyes and walk forward

steps.text: Paintings animate and needles shoot out, impaling your eyes. You scream into the dark.
A hidden door creaks open.
You stumble into a spiral stairwell leading up.
The door leads to Chandra Mahal. You're close now.
Spirits swirl around. You bow down and ask to be forgiven.
One spirit nods and fades. The others vanish. You ascend.
You reach the top. The mantra glows on the wall.
The spirits rage at your haste. You are hurled into the void.
Light pours in. A door appears. You step out... back into the library. The book lies shut.
The palace trembles. But the door opens. You run out—free.
